classic.name: Fenway Park
classic.description: Historic, small-capacity ballpark, home of the Red Sox & occasional big-name concert venue.

classic.name: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
classic.description: Neoclassical & modern wings house a vast collection from ancient Egyptian to contemporary American.

classic.name: The Harvard Museum of Natural History
classic.description: Extensive natural-science collections, including animals, minerals & the famous Glass Flowers.

classic.name: Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University
classic.description: Harvard University's free outdoor tree & plant museum also offers walking tours & family activities.

classic.name: Boston Public Library - Central Library
classic.description: Historic library with grand, Renaissance-style architecture, murals by John Singer Sargent & tours.

classic.name: Symphony Hall
classic.description: Shoebox-shaped concert hall with premier acoustics that's home to the Boston Pops Orchestra.

classic.name: Boston Common
classic.description: Storied, nearly 50-acre urban park that hosted British troops during the American Revolution.

classic.name: Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum
classic.description: Evocative of a 15th-century Venetian palace, this museum houses a world-class art collection.

classic.name: Museum of Science
classic.description: Venerable institution with interactive exhibits, dome-shaped IMAX/3-D film theater & a planetarium.

foodie.name: Harvard Art Museums
foodie.description: Harvard's oldest museum, featuring European & American art from the Middle Ages to the present day.

foodie.name: Boston Sail Loft
foodie.description: Waterside maritime mainstay with floor-to-ceiling windows & seafood staples, plus bar scene.

foodie.name: Bova's Bakery
foodie.description: Family-owned bakeshop, opened in 1932, offering up breads, cookies & sandwiches 24 hours a day.

foodie.name: Wilson Farm Inc
foodie.description: Upscale market for farm-fresh produce, homemade baked goods & prepared foods, plus meat & seafood.

foodie.name: Fairmont Copley Plaza, Boston
foodie.description: Landmark 1912 lodging featuring an American brasserie, event space & a rooftop fitness center.
foodie.address: 138 St James Ave, Boston, MA 02116, USA

foodie.name: The Friendly Toast
foodie.description: Trendy hangout serving all-day breakfasts in quirky surroundings, with vegan options.

foodie.name: Modern Pastry Shop
foodie.description: Pastries, cakes, pies & cookies fill the cases at this unassuming, family-run Italian bakery.

foodie.name: Trident Booksellers & Cafe
foodie.description: Indie bookstore & cafe with a big all-day breakfast menu, veggie options & a relaxed vibe.

adventure.name: Public Garden
adventure.description: Placid, verdant, circa-1837 city park with a lagoon, boat rides, fountains & other sights.

adventure.name: Charles River Esplanade
adventure.description: This green space along the river offers a walking/jogging path, various events & views of the city.

adventure.name: Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University
adventure.description: Harvard University's free outdoor tree & plant museum also offers walking tours & family activities.

adventure.name: Fan Pier Park
adventure.description: Manicured & landscaped walk on the marina with grassy seating areas, benches, tables & fire pits.

adventure.name: Middlesex Fells Reservation
adventure.description: 2,575-acre natural haven including hiking trails around a pond, plus areas for dog-walking & biking.

adventure.name: Breakheart Reservation
adventure.description: This forest with hiking trails, lakes & a river offers activities such as fishing & swimming.

adventure.name: Boston Common
adventure.description: Storied, nearly 50-acre urban park that hosted British troops during the American Revolution.

adventure.name: Castle Island
adventure.description: Site of Fort Independence (open in the summer), with beach, picnic & jogging areas.
adventure.address: 2010 William J Day Blvd, Boston, MA 02127, USA

adventure.name: Harvard Yard
adventure.description: This sprawling treed area is the oldest part of the Harvard campus, with many historic buildings.

adventure.name: Cutler Park Reservation
adventure.description: Wetland preserve with a freshwater marsh & lake for bird-watching, hiking, fishing & canoeing.
